datascilib.Classifiers.DecisionTree

Class DescisionTreeEstimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • datascilib.Classifiers.DecisionTree.DescisionTreeEstimator

  • public class DescisionTreeEstimator
extends java.lang.Object

    Descision Tree Estimator

    Decision Tree Estimator is a tree that splits fitted values into a tree, where at each split, the fitted X and Y is split based on a threshold and feature that optimizes the GINI gain.

    If the tree is a leaf, returns a randomly selected classifier from the labels stored in that tree.

    Since:
    2020-04-29

    • Method Detail

      • fit

        public void fit(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Double>> X,
                java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> Y)
        Fits a 2-D List of Doubles X and a 1-D List of Integers Y. Compares every possible combination of thresholds and features to find the optimal combination that leads to the most gain. Splits the X and Y into two trees that recursively split until gain can't be increased. Checks of: empty lists, null values
        Parameters:
        X - is a 2-D List of Double points
        Y - is a 1-D List of Integer labels

      • splitTree

        private void splitTree(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Double>> splitX,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> splitY,
                       int feature_idx,
                       double threshold,
                       DescisionTreeEstimator currentTree)

      • predict

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> predict(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Double>> X)
        Predicts the labels for a 2-D List of Doubles X. Compares features and thresholds. Traverses trees until a classifier is returned. Checks of: empty lists
        Parameters:
        X - is a 2-D List of Double points.
        Returns:
        1-D List of Integer labels corresponding to X.

      • predictHelper

        private java.lang.Integer predictHelper(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> X)
        Helper function for predict(List). Predicts the labels for a List of Doubles X. Compares features and thresholds. Traverses trees until a classifier is returned. Checks of: empty lists
        Parameters:
        X - is a 1-D List of Double points.
        Returns:
        Integer label corresponding to X.
